title: Paddy Connolly
text:
Patrick Connolly (born 25 June 1970 in <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>) is a Scottish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>. In a twenty-year playing career, he made over 100 appearances for both <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a> and <a href="St%20Johnstone%20F.C.">St Johnstone</a>; he also played for <a href="Airdrieonians%20F.C.%20%281878%29">Airdrieonians</a>, <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Greenock Morton</a>, <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a>, <a href="Stirling%20Albion%20F.C.">Stirling Albion</a> and <a href="Brechin%20City%20F.C.">Brechin City</a>. He made three appearances for the <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Scotland under-21 team</a> in 1990.
After retiring from playing, Connolly was assistant manager of <a href="Albion%20Rovers%20F.C.">Albion Rovers</a> and <a href="Alloa%20Athletic%20F.C.">Alloa Athletic</a>, and was <a href="caretaker%20manager">caretaker manager</a> of Alloa on two occasions in 2015.
Career.
Connolly started his career with <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a>. He spent ten years at <a href="Tannadice%20Park">Tannadice</a>, after which he joined <a href="Airdrieonians%20F.C.%20%281878%29">Airdrie</a> for a short time, before moving to <a href="St%20Johnstone%20F.C.">St Johnstone</a> in 1998. Connolly spent six years with the Saints, including short loan spells at <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Morton</a> and <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a>. Despite being sent out on loan, Connolly agreed a new three-year contract in May 2001, amidst interest from former manager and <a href="Plymouth%20Argyle%20F.C.">Plymouth Argyle</a> manager <a href="Paul%20Sturrock">Paul Sturrock</a>. Connolly missed the final year of his contract due to a <a href="Anterior%20cruciate%20ligament%20injury">cruciate ligament injury</a>, and upon leaving <a href="McDiarmid%20Park">McDiarmid Park</a> in 2004, returned to Ayr, where he spent a season before playing the following season with <a href="Stirling%20Albion%20F.C.">Stirling Albion</a>. Connolly joined former Dundee United colleague <a href="Michael%20O%27Neill%20%28footballer%29">Michael O'Neill</a> at <a href="Brechin%20City%20F.C.">Brechin City</a> in May 2006.
Disallowed goal.
During his time at Dundee United, Connolly was involved in one of Scottish football's more bizarre moments when he was denied a hat-trick in a February 1993 match against <a href="Partick%20Thistle%20F.C.">Partick Thistle</a> at <a href="Firhill%20Stadium">Firhill</a> after referee <a href="Les%20Mottram">Les Mottram</a> failed to notice his shot had entered the goal and come back from the supporting stanchion. Despite Partick defender <a href="Martin%20Clark%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201968%29">Martin Clark</a> catching the ball and handing it to goalkeeper <a href="Andy%20Murdoch%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201968%29">Andy Murdoch</a> to restart, Mottram <a href="Ghost%20goal">missed both the goal and handball</a> to wave play on. Connolly scored twice in the match in a 4–0 win. Mottram went on to officiate in the <a href="1994%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1994 World Cup</a> the following year. The incident resulted in the stanchions from which the ball had rebounded, previously widely used, being removed in a re-design of football goalposts. In 2018, at the same end of the stadium, a similar incident occurred, with Partick Thistle this time being denied a legitimate goal.
Coaching career.
Connolly became assistant to brother-in-law <a href="Paul%20Martin%20%28Scottish%20footballer%29">Paul Martin</a> at <a href="Albion%20Rovers%20F.C.">Albion Rovers</a> in July 2008. Nine months later, he left the club due to work commitments elsewhere, joining <a href="Fulham%20F.C.">Fulham</a> as a scout around November 2009.
On 18 May 2011, Connolly was appointed assistant manager to <a href="Paul%20Hartley">Paul Hartley</a> at <a href="Alloa%20Athletic%20F.C.">Alloa Athletic</a>. He continued as assistant manager under <a href="Barry%20Smith%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201974%29">Barry Smith</a> and was appointed caretaker manager after Smith left the club in March 2015. Connolly continued to work for Alloa under the management of <a href="Danny%20Lennon">Danny Lennon</a> and was appointed caretaker when Lennon resigned in December 2015.
Personal life.
Connolly's son <a href="Aidan%20Connolly">Aidan Connolly</a> is a footballer who also played for <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a>, before joining <a href="Raith%20Rovers%20F.C.">Raith Rovers</a> in 2016.
